benchmark_details.name: PARADEHATE (Parallel Dataset for Hate Speech Detoxification)
benchmark_details.overview: PARADEHATE is a large-scale parallel dataset specifically for hate speech detoxification, consisting of over 8,000 hate/non-hate text pairs, generated through an LLM-in-the-loop methodology replacing human annotators.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality parallel dataset for evaluating models in the task of online hate speech detoxification.

data.source: Aggregated from multiple hate speech datasets including CreHate, HateXplain, Davidson, and Founta.
data.annotation: Automated generation and validation using LLMs for rephrasing, content preservation checking, and toxicity evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by comparing LLM-generated texts against original references and assessing semantic fidelity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in detoxification tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: BART fine-tuned on PARADEHATE achieves style accuracy of 0.95, content preservation of 0.78, and fluency of 0.71.
methodology.validation: Dataset was validated through comparison with traditional methods and human-annotated data.
